definition: to listen carefully
to examine/truth (Buddhism)
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
smile (archaic)
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow

sentences.chinese: 去歌唱吧，犹如无人在一边谛听。

sentences.english: Trees are the earth’s endless effort to speak to the listening heaven.
sentences.chinese: 森林是大地对谛听的天宇无休止的倾诉。

sentences.english: That makes the heavens be mute.
sentences.chinese: 使九天谛听这乐声悠悠。

sentences.english: She began making time to listen to my thoughts and opinions.
sentences.chinese: 她也开始抽时刻谛听我的意见和设法。

sentences.english: I listened, and tossed about, and, finally, dressed and descended.
sentences.chinese: 我谛听着，翻来覆去，终于穿上衣服下了楼。

sentences.english: Pierre listened to the colonel's remarks, and nodded his head approvingly .
sentences.chinese: 皮埃尔谛听上校说话，点点头，表示赞同。

sentences.english: Im like the road in the night listening to the footfalls of its memories in silence.
sentences.chinese: 我像那夜间之路，静悄悄的谛听著回忆的足音。

sentences.english: But the whole world, still to listen, and God in His heaven smiles.
sentences.chinese: 但是整个世界都在谛听，上帝也在苍穹中露出了微笑。

sentences.english: He listened carefully to the sounds from next door.
sentences.chinese: 他脸贴着墙，谛听着隔壁的说话声。

sentences.english: They sat, listening, and afraid to speak, for hours.
sentences.chinese: 他们坐下来凝神谛听，几个小时连话也不敢说。

sentences.english: The shabby house seemed to listen.
sentences.chinese: 好像这整座陋屋在屏息谛听。

sentences.english: The Buddha said:" Listen and think, do not forget."

definition: Kṣitigarbha Bodhisattva, the Bodhisattva of the Great Vow (to save all souls before accepting Bodhi)/also translated Earth Treasury, Earth Womb, or Earth Store Bodhisattva
Kṣitigarbha, the Bodhisattva of the Great Vow (to save all souls before accepting Bodhi)/also translated Earth Treasury, Earth Womb, or Earth Store Bodhisattva
tathagata (Buddha's name for himself, having many layers of meaning - Sanskrit: thus gone, having been Brahman, gone to the absolute etc)
Kṣitigarbha Bodhisattva, the Bodhisattva of the Great Vow (to save all souls before accepting Bodhi)/also translated Earth Treasury, Earth Womb, or Earth Store Bodhisattva
bodhi (Sanskrit)/enlightenment (Buddhism)
Manjushri, the Bodhisattva of keen awareness
Prince Ananda, cousin of the Buddha and his closest disciple
Samantabhadra, the Buddhist Lord of Truth
Guanyin, the Bodhisattva of Compassion or Goddess of Mercy (Sanskrit Avalokiteśvara)
Guanyin, the Bodhisattva of Compassion or Goddess of Mercy (Sanskrit Avalokiteśvara)
Manjushri, the Bodhisattva of keen awareness
pinyin: Wen2 shu1 shi1 li4 Pu2 sa4

definition: revealer (protective god)
Bai Ze or White Marsh, legendary creature of ancient China
Bodhisattva (Buddhism)
to communicate with the spirits/psychic/(ears) sensitive/(information) accurate
Zhu Bajie 豬八戒|猪八戒[Zhu1 Ba1 jie4] or Zhu Wuneng, Pigsy or Pig (in Journey to the West)
